channel.title: Project-Pvp RSC
channel.description:
Hey, i always wanted to create a rsc server and rite now i think i found a nice source. But i really need help, how do you make a client? or edit one? cuz i have a client i want to know how to edit the ip in the files, and how to edit the backround pic etc. if anyone can supply me with my missing info that will be ownage, Thanks!
You can go to my forums at [url=http://www.projectunlimited.forumotion.com]http://www.projectunlimited.forumotion.com[/url] here u can also post if u know some good stuff and tips on the making of project-pvp RSC :) ty and hope to see replies soon! :D

item.title: Project-Pvp RSC
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

lol k:

easy rsc, i cant seem to make public when i started, and divine pk u cant drop items

Divine Pk can drop items… Just you obviously don’t have the source which can :).

Read full topic

item.title: Project-Pvp RSC
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Hamachi is fine too but you won’t get lots of players that are willing to download hamachi to try out your server. As far as portforwarding on wirless networks go, I also can’t seem to access my router through my wireless however; I was able to portforward by going to one of the comp’s with a wired connection and forward the ports using the ip of the wireless computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Project-Pvp RSC
item.dc:creator: @Skillapwnz Skillapwnz
item.description:
@Skillapwnz wrote:

damn, i noticed i can’t portforward with wireless network + for a bit to test out my server development wasn’t neccesarly hosting it with portforward but i was using hamachi just so people can try it out if they wanted to use hamachi. but i just developped (and im talkin about rs2 there but i thought for now i can use hamachi for rsc)the server and put online to test and ppl would try it out with hamachi if they wanted :S

Read full topic

item.title: Project-Pvp RSC
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Easy-rsc is a fine source to use. Don’t use divine pk because its an older version of Easy-rsc/RSCD with many bugs in it. You will need to put your ip or your servers ip in settings.ini which is located in your client files. Make sure you have all ports forwarded correctly and that your firewall isn’t blocking incomming connections if you are hosting from your home pc.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Skillapwnz Skillapwnz
item.description:
@Skillapwnz wrote:

Source is gonna either (since im new to rsc) gonna be easyrsc comes with client etc.

Or divinepk. but like i got these from source list so i dont have any pics of em. easyrsc its good i kinda know how to edit but its just. i go to settings of client change the ip to my ip. then well i restart client still don’t work. so i try to compile the client. then once i compile it it gets a error. i think its the same when i compile the server. but idk i can also try divine pk.
